result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Robert T Sexton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Conditions:
Expires 2-16-14.
During term of DCA, defendant shall commit no violation to level of probable cause.
If DCA not revoked during term, charge shall be dismissed.
No revocation may take place without hearing before Court and notice to all parties.
Defendant waives right to speedy trial.
Invent expiration date expires, nothing in DCA or laws of State shall prevent State from seeking revocation of DCA if State has filed motion to revoke prior to the expiration date.
Defendant shall notify Clerk of Court's Office within 72 hours of change of address.
Defendant shall comply with all probation rules and regulations of the supervision ordered in this case's other conviction(s).
No violent or abusive contact with the victim
Complete 6 hours of anger management or family counseling
Provide the DA's office with proof of compliance with the counseling
  Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia.

supervisions.notes: Early discharge at recommendation of agent if obligations fulfilled after 6 months

miscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia
No criminal conduct
